name: Richard Michelson
bio:
Richard Michelson was born in Brooklyn, New York. He is the author of the poetry collections More Money than God (University of Pittsburgh Press, 2015), Battles & Lullabies (University of Illinois Press, 2006), Tap Dancing for Relatives (University Press of Florida, 1985), and two fine press collaborations with the artist Leonard Baskin. His poetry has appeared in such anthologies as the Norton Introduction to Poetry, Unsettling America: An Anthology of Contemporary Multicultural Poetry, and Beyond Lament: Poets of the World Bearing Witness to the Holocaust.
In addition to his poetry collections, Michelson has also published eighteen children’s books, which have been listed among the Ten Best of the Year by The New York Times, Publishers Weekly, and The New Yorker; and among the best Dozen of the Decade by Amazon.com. He has been a finalist for the Massachusetts Book Award, the National Jewish Book Award, and the Harlem Book Fest Philis Wheatley Award. He has received two Skipping Stones Multicultural Book Awards, a National Parenting Publication Gold Medal and an International Reading Association Teacher’s Choice Award. In 2009, Michelson became the only author to receive both the Sydney Taylor Gold and Silver Medal from the Association of Jewish Librarians.
Michelson, the former poet laureate of Northampton, Massachusetts, is the host of Northampton Poetry Radio and the recipient of a 2016 Massachusetts Cultural Council Fellowship.
